Name: Geruza
Description: ‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Paraiba News, online portal, 18.10.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found with numerous stab wounds in her apartment. None of her belongings were found missing. She was of Peruvian origin.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Diario Hoy, online portal, 2.2.2011

Name: Laura Renan
Description:
Laura was a sex worker and was killed on the street.

TvT partner organisation: Grupo Gay da Bahia (Tabelas 2011)

Name: Lorraine
Description: ‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Leo Mendes LGBTT blog, 19.02.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The crime occurred opposite the Jockey Club in Sao Paulo's Zona Sul. According to a witness, there was the perpetrator had a discussion with the victim before he killed her and fled the scene in a pickup.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: O Tempo Online, online portal, 5.2.2011

Name: (Esteban Gonzalez Gomez)
Description:
The victim's body had been abandoned on a plot of land and showed numerous wounds from shotguns in the head and the back.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; Provincia, online journal, 7.2.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was found on the highway Charallave-Ocumare. The body showed wounds of stabs and a gun shot. The police suspect that the victim was killed inside a car and then dragged to a slope.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; El Aragueno, online portal, 8.3.2011

Name: Fernanda
Description:
Fernanda was shot by a watchman.

TvT partner organization: Grupo Gay da Bahia

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was shot along with seven other persons in a bar. The police consider failure to pay regarding an extortion to a criminal gang to be the most likely motif.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; Expreso online journal, w/o date

Name: Nicol Balanta
Description:
Nicole was killed by a man using the name "El Tigre".

TvT partner organization: Observatorio Ciudadano Trans

Name: (Luis Fernando Ormeno)
Description:
The victim was killed with a bottleneck. She was from the city of Manabi and identified by friends.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: El Universo, online portal, 16.2.2011

Name: Moni (Roberto Marcos) Castro
Description:
Moni had been well known in the General Rodriquez district of Buenos Aires in the 1980s, as she was a prominent hairdresser. Since the 90s, she was known in the nearby district of Moreno. Moni was shot shortly before midnight on a street where she used to do sex work. She was with a colleague as two young men on a motorbike approached her. An exchange followed that ended with one of the men shooting Moni. Moni told her colleague that the men wanted to rob her before she collapsed. She died in hospital.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; Semanario Actualidad, blog, 10.3.2011

Name: Capenga (Eduardo Marinho da Silva)
Description:
Capenga's body was found on a piece of wasteland near Rua Macedo de Aguiar showing wounds of beatings, stabs and strangulation.

According to residents, Capenga, who was a sex worker, went with a client to the wasteland where the murder happened.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Tribuna da Bahia, online portal, 15.02.2011

Name: Poh Hiao Peng/ Pondan Peng
Source ref: tgeu/15 Feb 2011/Poh Hiao Peng/ Pondan Peng
Description:
The victim was beaten to death with a hammer by a motorcyclist in the afternoon. The case has been classified as murder.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: The Star, 15.02.2011

Name: Mireya (Ramiro Solano Jimenez)
Description:
La Mireya was stabbed to death in the early morning by a 22 year-old men who had been robbed previously on his way home from a bar and was reported to have wanted to take revenge on someone, killing Mireya, who was not involved in the robbery.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Dia a Dia, online portal, 18.2.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim and the murderer were reported to had been exchanging sms and mms for six years before they met. When the younger person discovered the 29 year-old was a 'man' he committed murder.

TvT Expert Questionnaire on the Social and Legal Situation of Trans People / Trans-Fuzja Foundation Poland

Name: Tyra Trent
Description:
Tyra was found asphyxiated to death in the basement of an empty apartment on Virginia Avenue. She had been reported missing two weeks prior.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Baltimore Sun, 04.03.2011

https://www.queerty.com/who-killed-tyra-trent-20110223

https://web.archive.org/web/20110321125411/http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2011-02-22/news/bs-md-ci-vacant-body-murder-20110222_1_transgender-woman-transgender-people-prostitutes

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/aug/01/murder-transgender-women-baltimore-heighten-fears-mia-henderson

Name: Aline (Rugian Oneil de Carlos)
Description:
Aline's body was found on Rua Francisco Pezzi. Earlier she had celebrated her birthday, but had left afterwards with a colleague to work.

Aline had moved to Caxias do Sul from the state of Paraná.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Pioneiro, online journal, 21.02.2011

Name: (Víctor Jose) Cruz Escorcia
Description:
The victim was a sex worker. The perpetrators shot her seven times and fled. As she had received death threats three days before, the police speculate it might have been a crime of vengeance.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: El Quetzalteco, 24.2.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was about 55 years old. The body was found in a state of decomposition in a creek. It is estimated that the body had been in the water for about three months.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; RioDoce, online portal, 22.2.2011

Name: Vitória Maria Viana ("Jessica")
Description:
Jessica was found dead in her car on Avenida Lucas Nogueira Garcez. She had been shot twice - once in the head and once in the neck. Nothing was stolen.

Reportedly she was killed by two men on a passing motorcycle.

> A [trans woman] was killed [at 10:15pm] on Thursday night (24) in São Bernardo do Campo, in Greater São Paulo. The crime took place on Avenida Lucas Nogueira Garcez, in the city center, close to km 18 of the Anchieta highway.
>
> According to police, the [trans woman] was driving in a red EcoSport, passing down the avenue, when a motorcycle with two men intercepted the car and shot her with several shots.
>
> The driver died on the spot and her companion, who was another [trans woman], ran away from the scene. There is no information if she was also injured. The police officers who attended the incident reported that the victim was the head of other [trans women] on Rua Indico, who was known in the region for renting hotels and other points for [trans women].
>
> The two men who shot fled on a motorcycle towards Diadema. The case will be forwarded to the 1st Police District of São Bernardo do Campo.

A relative told the authorities that Jessica had lived openly as transgender since she was 22 and was well liked in the area.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Diario do ABC, online journal, 25.2.2011

https://www.geledes.org.br/travesti-e-morto-a-tiros-em-sao-bernardo-do-campo/

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was found dead on a road in Baguio, stabbed at the back and head and with signs of torture.

Note that the date of this report is unknown. The date given is based on the position of the corresponding entry in the TGEU list.

TvT partner organization: STRAP 21

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was found dead along the road of Brgy Asin East of Malasiqui town with signs of torture.

Note that the date of this report is unknown. The date given is based on the position of the corresponding entry in the TGEU list.

TvT partner organization: STRAP

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was found dead along the road of Brgy Gueguesangen, Santa Barbara town with a wound on the forehead and a stab wound in the armpit and with signs of torture through strangulation.

Note that the date of this report is unknown. The date given is based on the position of the corresponding entry in the TGEU list.

TvT partner organization: STRAP March 2011
